meanings.sent1: The forfeiter returned the stolen goods to make amends.
meanings.sent2: The forfeiter handed over the trophy after being caught cheating.
meanings.sent3: The forfeiter accidentally dropped the prize in the mud, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She was a forfeiter of her own happiness, always putting others first.
meanings.sent5: The young forfeiter learned the value of honesty the hard way.

meanings.definition: To lose or be deprived of something as a penalty for wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: He had to forfeit his allowance for a week as a punishment.
meanings.sent2: If you break the rules, you will forfeit your chance to win the game.
meanings.sent3: She chose to forfeit her turn in the game to help a friend instead.
meanings.sent4: The company will forfeit its profits if it doesn't meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to forfeit the match due to an injury, disappointing the fans.
